comments:
This bug seems like bug n.147269. 

>>> Environment: WinXP + Java 1.5.0_06 + Eclipse 3.2 RC/ + EMF 2.2.0 RC7 + ECF 0.8.5 
Furthermore,  we have downloaded from CVS the projects
- org.eclipse.ecf
- org.eclipse.ecf.discovery
- org.eclipse.ecf.example.collab
- org.eclipse.ecf.presence
- org.eclipse.ecf.provider
- org.eclipse.ecf.ui

>>> Steps to reproduce: 

- Start the ServerApplication: we have started the ServerApplication 
  - BOTH from the projects in the workspace by the menu ?Run? AND from the installed package by command shell  
    (once at a time, of course) and we have the above mentioned exception. 
- Start the clients: we have started 
  - BOTH the client installed IN Eclipse AND the ?ECF Example Collab Client? 
    once at a time and at the same time, on the same pc and on several pc, and we have the same exception.
 
-  Start the collaboration: we select ?Connect Workspace (new Dialog)? from ECF menu and specify the protocol ?ECF Generic? 

and Group ID   	      ?ecftcp://***.***.***.***:3282/server?.

The connection and presence awareness work well.

- Select ?CoBrowse?: Both ?Send CoBrowse Web with X? and ?CoBrowse URL...? (with group) allow to choose the url and then 

launches an exception (that follows) on the client who has requested to cobrowse. After the communication error, the client 

goes on (doesn?t crash) while others clients don?t notice anything.

>>> The exception is the following:
org.eclipse.ecf.core.SharedObjectCreateException: Container GUID[lpFF7i9Qr64_wd0pBRKQAWoFBbw-] had exception creating shared 

object GUID[LeZTcZelCrgqcgrr1F0BXwDB9Hc-]: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.ecf.example.collab.share.url.ExecURL

Same fix as bug #147269.  Fix checked in and will be present in 0.8.6 stable build.
